course_name: Master of Property Development and Planning
overview:
This course is designed for both property and planning practitioners, and graduates in related fields who wish to extend their qualifications and expertise in property development and planning. Graduates have a commitment to professionalism in the property and planning sector.

This course is for property and planning professionals who want to upgrade their qualifications or expertise or for those who wish to enter the property and planning industries. In their first year students develop an understanding of how to balance private and public interests in urban development, how urban economies work, how urban design and sustainability principles are applied, and how development feasibility is assessed.
awards: Master of Property Development and Planning (MPropDevPlan)
professional_recognition: This program is accredited by the Planning Institute of Australia.

learning_outcomes.text: Communicate and collaborate effectively in diverse contexts.
Identify, evaluate, and reflect on ethical issues and personal values to explore diverse perspectives and make sound judgements.
Formulate innovative solutions by applying creativity and initiative to complex problems in property development, planning, and related academic contexts.
Integrate and adapt property development and planning knowledge to analyse and respond to diverse contextual demands.
Use research principles and methods to generate, apply, and critically evaluate knowledge and concepts in property development and planning.

inherent_requirements:
Inherent (essential) requirements are academic and non-academic requirements that are essential to the successful completion of a course.

Prospective and current students should carefully read the Inherent (Essential) Requirements Statement below and consider whether they might experience challenges in successfully completing this course. This Statement should be read in conjunction with the UTS Student Rules.

Prospective or current student concerned about their ability to meet these requirements should discuss their concerns with the Academic Liaison Officer in their faculty or school and/or UTS Accessibility Service on 9514 1177 or at accessibility@uts.edu.au.

UTS will make reasonable adjustments to teaching and learning, assessment, professional experiences, course related work experience and other course activities to facilitate maximum participation by students with disabilities, carer responsibilities, and religious or cultural obligations in their courses.

For course specific information see the Faculty of Design, Architecture and Building Inherent (Essential) Requirements Statement.

study_plans.name: Autumn commencing, Minor project, Full time
Spring commencing, Minor project, Full time

notes:
Students who do not meet the admission requirements below may begin with a Graduate Certificate and progress to the Master of Property Development and Planning.

Graduate Certificate in Property Development --> Master of Property Development and Planning

-OR-

Graduate Certificate in Planning --> Master of Property Development and Planning

(Note that entry to the Masters via other UTS Graduate Certificates and Graduate Diplomas is also possible.)
admission_requirements:
Applicants must have completed a UTS recognised bachelor's degree, or an equivalent or higher qualification, or submitted other evidence of general and professional qualifications that demonstrates potential to pursue graduate studies.

Pathway 1

Pathway 2

For applicants with no Bachelor degree but holding a Graduate Certificate or Graduate Diploma not listed under pathway 1:

* Work experience is not restricted to Australia. It can be for anywhere in the world within the relevant cognate field.

The English proficiency requirement for international students or local applicants with international qualifications is: Academic IELTS: 6.5 overall with a writing score of 6.0; or TOEFL: paper based: 550-583 overall with TWE of 4.5, internet based: 79-93 overall with a writing score of 21; or AE5: Pass; or PTE: 58-64 with a writing score of 50; or C1A/C2P: 176-184 with a writing score of 169.

Eligibility for admission does not guarantee offer of a place.

; Admission requirements for Australian students (ATAR): None; Admission requirements for Chinese students (Gaokao score out of 750): None; Admission requirements for students with GCE A Levels: None; Admission requirements for Hong Kong students (HKDSE): None; Admission requirements for Indian students (AISSC): None; Admission requirements for Indian students (ISC): None; Admission requirements for students with IB or Predicted IB: None; Admission requirements for Malaysian students (STPM with 3 AL Subjects): None; Admission requirements for Singaporean students (A Level): None; Admission requirements for USA students (SAT 1): None; Admission requirements for UTS Foundation Studies students: None
career_options: Career options include positions in planning at local, metropolitan, and regional level, and property development in the private and public sectors.
course_structure: Students must complete 96 credit points made up of 84 credit points of core subjects and 12 credit points of electives.
